triples.name: Data synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL proposes a novel software-based approach to data synchronization across independent instruments using timestamps and network protocols.

triples.name: Clock synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL implements time synchronization across a local area network to ensure millisecond-precise synchronized recording across multiple devices.

triples.name: Multimodal learning
triples.relevance: LSL enables multimodal recording by synchronizing data from multiple sensors and instruments capturing different data modalities simultaneously.

triples.name: Neurophysiology
triples.relevance: LSL was built from the ground up for neurophysiological applications, enabling synchronized recording of neural and behavioral data.

triples.name: Brainâ€“computer interface
triples.relevance: LSL supports brain-computer interface applications as part of its broader neurobehavioral recording ecosystem.

triples.name: Real-time computing
triples.relevance: LSL provides real-time analysis environments and ensures continuous, millisecond-precise data recording with real-time synchronization.

triples.name: Jitter
triples.relevance: LSL implements jitter compensation to account for network delays and variability, ensuring accurate synchronized recording.

triples.name: Data acquisition
triples.relevance: LSL supports over 150 data acquisition device classes for synchronized collection of multimodal signals from various instruments.

triples.name: Timestamp
triples.relevance: LSL uses per-sample timestamps as the fundamental mechanism for synchronizing data streams across multiple independent instruments.

triples.name: Network Time Protocol
triples.relevance: LSL leverages time synchronization concepts similar to NTP to coordinate timestamps across devices on a local area network.
